title: Update needed in javadoc for constructor Image(Device, ImageData)
description: The current javadoc for constructor Image(Device, ImageData) lacks clarity regarding potential exceptions, leading to confusion in usage.
OB: When instantiating Image with a Device and ImageData, it can sometimes throw org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Unsupported color depth.
EB: The javadoc for constructor Image(Device, ImageData) should explicitly mention that it can throw org.eclipse.swt.SWTException when encountering an unsupported color depth in the provided ImageData.
SR:
1. Navigate to the constructor Image(Device, ImageData).
2. Create an Image instance with a Device and an ImageData of unsupported color depth.
3. Verify that the constructor throws org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Unsupported color depth.
